Attaching Existing Labels

After a label has been created, it can be attached to new folders, items, or item revisions. This principle even applies to view labels, which can be adjusted to include new folders or items.

To attach an existing view or revision label to selected items:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select one or more items from the upper pane.

  4. Select Labels > Attach from the component or context menu. The Attach a Label dialog opens. This dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  5. To limit the list to a specific type of label, clear the appropriate check box.

  6. Select a label from the list.

  7. Click OK.

To attach an existing view or revision label to a specific item revision:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select the item from the upper pane.

  4. Select the Label tab. This action displays the Label pane, which lists all item revisions.

  5. Right-click an item revision to display the context menu.

  6. Select Attach. The Attach a Label dialog opens. This dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  7. To limit the list to a specific type of label, clear the appropriate check box.

  8. Select a label from the list.

  9. Click OK.

To attach an existing view or revision label to a folder and its contents:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder menu or context menu. The Labels dialog opens.

  3. Click Attach. The Attach a Label dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  4. To display only view labels or revision labels, clear the appropriate check box.

  5. Select a label.

  6. To attach the label to:

    • Only the selected folder, select the Folder only option button.

    • The folder and its items, select the Folder and items contained in folder option button.

    • The folder, its items, its child folders and their items, select the Everything in subtree rooted at folder option button.

    Note: Attaching a label to a folder always attaches it to the current configuration of each folder and item. It is not possible to label a past revision of a folder, although you can do so for items.

  7. Click OK.
